name: reigned
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
reign
C2 to be the king or queen of a country: Queen Victoria reigned over Britain from 1837 to 1901.
C2 to be the main feeling or quality in a situation or person: The bomb attacks produced a panic which reigned over the city. Love reigned supreme in her heart.
More examplesFewer examplesHow long did Queen Elizabeth reign?He only reigned for three years.Queens have reigned in Britain for 111 of the last 163 years.He reigned during some of the most turbulent times in English history.Confusion reigned as explosions erupted.
